definitions: the action of hiding or concealing something

examples.text: the viewpoint is creating awkward obscuration where there needs to be clarity and transparency
the response by the media has been a disgraceful combination of deliberate obscuration of the facts and smug complacency
it is important that prescribers make patients aware of the symptoms: visual obscurations, blurred vision, and neck pain

definitions: the concealment of one celestial body by the passage of another between it and the observer

examples.text: they saw a thin arc of the sun instead of its complete obscuration by the moon

shortDefinitions: concealment of celestial body by passage of another
